title: What is the overall charge of an atom if there are 3 protons, 3 electrons, and 3 neutrons? - Quora

response.answer_text: No charge. It will be electrically stable. Those with 3 protons and 3 neutrons are known as the isotope lithium-6. Those with 3 protons and 4 neutrons are known as the isotope lithium-7.
The overall charge of such an atom is null as charge of positive protons is compenstaed by negative charges of electrons. Of course for an observer paced outside this atom.
Zero. The 3 protons (each with a charge of +1) offset the 3 electrons (each with a charge of -1); the neutrons do not affect the overall charge (they each have zero charge).
If the number of protons is balanced by the number of electrons, the net charge on the atom is zero. Such is the case in your question.
